skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.
The swamp will rise again, its inhabitants enjoying the blessings of the Dark Gods once more.
The same enchanted mist that obscures Fimir Balefiend dwellings can also be conjured to confound and horrify would-be attackers on the battlefield.
They can see the Winds of Magic's ebb and flow, enabling them to make the best use of the magical power available.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Sometimes called the Restorer, the Ketzak Fimdirach is a male Fimir shaman of singular power, seen only once in a generation among his benighted species.

effects.description:
Recruitment health: +5% for all units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: A friend of the Ketzak Fimdirach is a friend of all Fimir, and of fouler things which live in the caves and swamps, far from prying, human eyes.
When a flying magical cleaver just isn't enough...

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"

skillTree.localised_description: With minacious magics galore, the Restorer can heal even gaping, sucking wounds beyond the limits of a Troll's natural regenerative capabilities.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Regeneration" for Chaos Frost Dragon and Dragon Ogre Shaggoth units
	(Hero's army)

Passive ability: "Horrible Regeneration" for Cygor, Beasts of Nurgle, Fimir Warriors and Skin Wolves units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast, this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.localised_description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

effects.description: Damage Building action: Additional 5% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 15% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 15% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 30% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

items.colour_text: To each of his Chieftains Tamurkhan granted a powerful talisman, to enhance their power, but also to yoke it to his own through Nurgle's immense will.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -25% for overcast spells

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.
